Words can't describe this hotel. Everything is super quality. The service of all the staff is excellent. The room is so big and has everything you need and more. The location is very convenient cause you have subway station next to the hotel. I didn't want to leave. Don't look other place.

Perfectly located just opposite of the Imperial Gardens and Ginza. Big rooms with dressing room,very good equipped (coffee maker etc). They offer two types of breakfast, I preferred buffet which was located in floor -1. Great selection of different foods and very good coffee. Very professional and helpful staff.

As you would expect, the rooms, views and service were excellent. Nothing is too much trouble including reservations for dinner, organising transport, maps of the Ginza area.They also organised an English speaking guide for us as well. We became experts at using the subway system which is quite simple (and cheap!) once you get the hang of it.We loved Tokyo and The Peninsula! It is an oasis within a very busy city.

Every single inch of this hotel is designed with guest comfort and delight as its primary focus. As an often grumpy guest, I could not find a single instance of an improvement I could recommend - they have truly thought of everything. From bedside controllers for heat/ac, lights, and music to the large, well-thought-out, walk-in closets - these rooms live much larger than they are (and they’re pretty big.) The room feels more like a penthouse apartment than a hotel room. The bathrooms are not just sumptuous, but smartly designed with everything well-laid out and within easy reach. Every morning we enjoyed breakfast in the smaller, Boutique Cafe in the basement. It included some buffet items as well as alacarte items. It seemed much quieter and more peaceful than breakfast in the lobby. The staff were friendly, attentive, professional and efficient. The hotel is very-well located. A short walk in any direction will land you in a different dynamic neighborhood. On Saturday there’s a wonderful flea market just a few minutes walk from the hotel, and there are several subway lines within a 5 minute walk for trips further afield.I think the world would be well-served if Peninsula would close this hotel to the public. They could then invite hoteliers and hospitality workers from around the world to stay here and learn how great hospitality is delivered. Although this is an expensive hotel, the things that make it great are not always expensive to deliver; they are the small, constant, extremely thoughtful gestures that demonstrate their wholehearted commitment to providing their guests with a perfect stay.I did have a discrepancy with the hotel over additional taxes and fees that were added to my bill when I checked out. I did not feel that these additional fees had been properly disclosed to me when making my reservation through American Express. Although it required a bit more persistence than I would have liked, The Peninsula corrected the discrepancy to my satisfaction and have corrected the way in which these fees are disclosed on Amex’s travel site. I am so glad this got resolved, as it removed my only disappointment and confirmed my sense that Peninsula Hotels is an organization that hears its guests and truly takes their concerns to heart. Special thanks to Fernando Bas Gil and Kevin Song for their attention and assistance.Thanks all for a magical stay in Tokyo - of which you all played an important part.
user_name:
EdinDC
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: My wife and I stayed at the Peninsula Tokyo on this trip. The hotel is first rate with a very luxurious room appointment. Staff are helpful and polite and fluent in English. A must in Asia for non native speakers. Location is central. Overall a great experience. The Peter restaurant is unrivaled. For food and ambiance. A shout out to hotel manager Mr. Joseph Lee who is very professional and top rate. Must stay if in Tokyo

The Peninsula Hotel has won my heart!!! The location is key. It is an 8-minute walk or taxi ride from the Tokyo Train Station, next to the Imperial Palace, and walking distance to Ginza. My husband and I would go jogging in the morning around the Imperial Palace and walk to various restaurants and shops. The Peninsula service is exceptional (6 Stars) including the check-in reception, transportation service, and hotel housekeeping and staff. I would like to personally thank the Concierge Team for working with me prior to my arrival with restaurant reservations and special requests including securing transportation to Mt. Fuji. The hotel itself is extremely comfortable, clean, and has great modern amenities (automatic shades/curtains, mood lighting, electric plugs/charging stations, etc). My husband and I had in-room dining for breakfast and it was delicious. The Peter (bar and restaurant) has amazing views. I simply cannot recommend this hotel enough.

Besides the expected excellence of the staff and facility (don't miss the indoor pool with the beautiful views), the location and access to the subway made traveling around Tokyo and suburbs effortless. Between walking and the subway, we did not need a taxi during our stay. Daily breakfast was excellent, as well as any in room service.

The Peninsula Hotel in Tokyo proved to be an exceptional choice of venue for our recent visit. The staff is courteous yet proficient, the bell desk helpful, and the concierge staff worked very hard to ensure my husband and I enjoyed the very best experience their hotel and their city could offer. I’m especially thankful for Rika’s good advice and assistance in booking tours, and the wonderful welcome surprise offered to us by the lovely Jacy at the reception desk. I ca think of no place we would rather stay in Tokyo than The Peninsula.

The Peninsula is very close to the royal gardens. The service is extrem friendly from the entrance to the reception. All is well trained. The view of our room was just to the backsides. The offices where just opposite.The price was very high for that.Airport pick up too. We learned the lesson. The lobby is quite small. People waiting on two benches, and the others are eating so close by.The music from above was quite loud , it could be because of the acoustic.Room service and housekeeping was excellent.

I was in Tokyo for four nights and had the great pleasure of staying at the Peninsula Hotel in Central Tokyo. While I usually stay in the nicest hotels in the many cities to which my business takes me, I have never stayed in a nicer hotel with more attentive and courteous service than the Peninsula. The suite was impeccable, each breakfast was outstanding and the staff amazingly respectful. Without a doubt, it will be my home in Tokyo every time I visit.
user_name:
rosienyc2016
New York City, New York

review_body: This was our 2nd visit after nearly 10 years and the rooms looked the same. Still one of the most impressive and spacious bathrooms I've come across. I emailed notifying of our anniversary but this was either overlooked or given to someone else. Once I followed up, staff were quick to send chocolates and champagne...just wished it was more a surprise for my husband. Other than that, truly impeccable service. Case in point, I left my reading glasses on the table and when we returned the housekeeping staff had placed eyeglass cleaning cloth beneath it. Location is in Ginza with direct access to the subway. We spent the weekend walking around the area.Would recommend.

I’ve stayed in a lot of hotels and this is one of the best! Among all the Peninsula branches, Pen Tokyo tops it all. The quality of service, the efficiency of the staff and the cleanliness of the rooms.... Amazing! The hotel is pricey but it’s worth every penny. I also love the fact that you have the option to have your complimentary breakfast in your room which decongests the lobby. And the size of the rooms... wow! We had a wonderful stay and will surely be back.

If you can afford it, do yourself a favour and stay at the Peninsula Tokyo. The basic room is wonderful and has to be the best room that my wife and I have stayed in. There is so much space and storage that even with all our luggage/clothes etc, there was still plenty of space. Our room 1302 whilst not having the best view was so comfortable, quiet and full of all the necessary items to make our stay to remember. There were light and control switches all about the room so you never had to move far to close/open/turn on/off any of the items in the room. The bathroom was so very clean and there was every items you could want there. The pool is the best that I have ever been in and the amentities at the pool were 1st class. The resturants were a bit dear but it was the Peninsula so you pay for what you get, which was all excellent. The location is within walking distance of Ginza, train station and subways. The staff everywhere within the hotel, always acknowledge us in a very friendly and professional manner. Special thanks to Mari and Martin who made my wife and I feel very special every time they saw us. Will be coming back soon, we enjoyed it so much and it was worth every $ we spent.

This hotel is wonderful and a tranquil place to stay. The room was perfect in every way.The attention to detail and the quality of service was exceptional. Hotel staff were brilliant.We had an amazing meal with exceptional service in 'Peter' their restaurant overlooking the imperial palace gardens. Try to sit by the window if you can, the view is fantastic.Afternoon Tea also looked amazing.

I have been very fortunate to stay in some of the finest hotels in the world in more than 70 countries. The Peninsula Tokyo is my favorite in the world. Check-in, service, room and food were of the highest standards. I am very much looking forward to my next visit.

The hotel is located in the central Tokyo and closed to the Imperial palace. There is a jogging track around the palace for 3.2 mi (5 km). Furthermore, it takes only 8 min walk to Ginza, dining and shopping area.

The Peninsula chain of restaurants is considered among the top in quality, service and luxury. The Tokyo property certainly holds to those standards. Located in the heart of the city, overlooking the Imperial Palace and a 5 minute walk to the Ginza, you would be hard pressed to find a better base from which to see th city. There are elements of true old school here with young women in white bellmen uniforms to greet you as you enter the lobby, and a jaz band playing most of the day three stories above the lobby/restaurant. The lobby is beautifully decorated and worth a visit just to see it. Check in was swift and efficient. The rooms leave nothing to complain about. Our basic room had a very large luxurious bath with separate shower and tub and two sinks. There was also a huge walk in closet/dressing room. The bedroom had a king bed, couch and sitting area. High end grooming products, high thread count sheets, toilet with heated seat, thick towers and bathrobes, the list goes on and on. This is a top of the line hotel. You can’t do better than this but the price is steep. Worth it.
user_name:
Robert T
New York City, New York

review_body: M and I have stayed at The Peninsula in Tokyo a few times before, and this time round, we stayed only one night but it was still magical. Everything was perfect: the location, the hospitality and the service. I was rather impressed that they allowed us a late checkout as our return flight to Singapore wasn't till 10:55. A late checkout, as everyone knows, is much appreciated and we certainly did. It was foul weather in Tokyo when we were there but The Peninsula offered a warm sanctuary from the not ideal weather condition. I've stayed at many reasonably good hotels in Tokyo before – The Ritz Carlton, The Okura, The Imperial to name a few - but The Peninsula remains my fave all these years because of its sincerity and warmth. it almost felt like a homecoming on this last trip.

Our go-to hotel whenever we come to Tokyo. Tried others but nowhere as convenient or as comfortable as The Peninsula Tokyo. We took a connecting room and with the doors open it felt like an apartment, with great space. The steam room on the 6th floor became a daily morning routine. The shaved ice fountain to cool down is amazingly refreshing. Staff went to great lengths to help and a young guy on the front desk was a die hard Patriots fan who helped me make sure I get to watch the Super Bowl.One major criticism is that the ground floor lobby restaurants closes way too early at 9 pm. Sometimes we wanted to sit and have a hot drink after returning from dinner. Also the breakfast bread basket is very stingy. When you ask for some toast, they only give you one slice!Love the hotel overall though.

From Washington DC and read extensive reviews of hotels in Tokyo before my trip. I narrowed it down to The Pen, The Ritz, Mandarin or Aman. Had stayed in NYC Peninsula Hotel once and that pushed me towards The Pen in Tokyo. Tokyo location has nicer bathrooms and more attentive staff. Never waited a moment for anything. The staff is fluent in English and anticipates your needs. If they sense you want to linger then they let you linger. If you are in a hurry then they almost run getting you what you need. During evening dinner rush there are 6 people staffing the front of the hotel and speak directly to your taxi since even with an address some of the restaurants are hard to find. Tell the concierge you want to go watch hunting and they print a couple maps with directions. Or ask about walking the Imperial gardens and they suggest taking in the close by shrine also.As far as the lobby restaurant, i thought it was really unique for breakfast since there was always action. The included breakfast was full (croissant, yogurt, 2 eggs, bacon, toast, grapefruit juice, coffee or Japanese) and was delicious. I never ate dinner there but why would you with more Michelin restaurants in Tokyo than France. The concierge arranged 3 dinner reservations before our arrival.I will skip the incredible room because it has been covered elsewhere.I dont think the spa gets the attention it deserves. Try going for just a sauna before dinner and i promise you will be completely refreshed. Truly an oasis. I frequent the Four Seasons spa in DC and until now thought it was indulgent.We went for drinks in the lounges at the Ritz and the Aman. The Ritz is stuck in the past and the service was really slow, understaffed and frustrating in comparison. The Aman was very hip with a beautiful lounge with live sax accompanying electronic DJ. If it was in a better neighborhood it might be a consideration. The Ginza neighborhood is great for shopping with everything from Dr Martens to Prada. About 7 minutes to the Tokyo station so you can take the bullet train nonstop to Narita.There is also a subway line in the basement once you get comfortable.Bottom line is if you are Marriott, SPG or Ritz platinum then consider them due to your personal advantage. But if not then The Pen. I think part of what makes it work is they dont have any frequent flyer program so it is just paying guests. you will see that all the other 5 star hotels occupy the top 10-15 floors of office buildings. The Pen is stand alone and much easier to run up to the room between shopping, visiting a shrine and dinner.

The Pen Tokyo still holds its own against the top hotels in a city littered with great ones, even against newer contenders such as Aman, Prince Gallery, Palace and Andaz.We stayed in a Deluxe Park View room, which is one of the lead-in room categories. At 54 square meters, however, it's Junior Suite-like in its size and layout; there was a sitting area and a desk, and the bathroom and dressing area are quite large.Given that it's a city hotel in a city that we are intimately familiar with, we did not need (nor did we expect) much in the way of service. That said, all staff members (front desk, maids, doorman, waiters, etc.) were all on top of things, and did it with a smile.Tokyo is a very safe city with very convenient transportation options, so it's debatable whether it is necessary to splurge on a top-end hotel. Generally speaking, we've found rates at the Pen to be lower than its competitors (YMMV), making this a no-brainer when this is the case.

My wife and I recently had the opportunity to revisit Happy Hour at the Tokyo Peninsula's "Peter the Bar". Having been to this establishment previously on several occasions, we looked forward to enjoying the wonderful cocktails expertly made at this facility. Once again we encountered the ambience, professionalism and great service expected at "Peters". Of particular note was the hostess "Roxanne" who kindly seated us at the bar. She made us both feel like royalty in a way that one seldom experiences. Somehow, it made the evening seem very special.

I had originally booked a garden view room with my American Express card and when I had come to check in, the desk had delightfully told me that I had been double upgraded to their executive suite. I've never been in the pinnacle of luxury until i've been to this hotel.The amount of hospitality I received was amazing. Immediately after checking in, I used the enormous bathtub and relaxed away all of my worries using up all of the provided bath salts and other amenities that I thought were a one time use. When I had departed the room to explore the local city. When I got back to my room, I was greeted with folded clothes (that I had originally thrown everywhere) and restocked amenities that I thought were originally one time use.The communication between myself and the room services was quick and seemless. The food they brought me for dinner and breakfast was by far some of the most delicious food. They were extremely thoughtful and I didn't have to assist in anything. They meticulously set everything up and I had the most wonderful time.I HIGHLY recommend you stay here for your trip. Whether its for business, pleasure, or anything in between. Well worth the money and well worth the experience.

My family and I spend the New Years in Tokyo, the hotel was amazing ,rooms very well designed everything you need you will find it, very professional receptionist quick check in , concierge team very helpful, 2 places for breakfast which was great. Very convenient locatin ,mostly evry thing tourist need is either walking distance or by sub way which the station is connected to the hotel .We love and enjoy it
user_name:
Om Rakan A
Riyadh, Saudi Arabia

review_body: We stayed here for three nights, two separated by a third for a trip to Kyoto. The price is high but if you’re looking for really feeling like a valued guest, with a beautiful room, great food, and a staff that is engaging, seemingly aware of exactly how you want to be treated, stay here. I booked it for an anniversary expecting an excellent experience and it was prefect. Great location but the real news here is that they simply do everything well. It’s expensive for me but I look at it as a luxury that I really feel happy I indulged in.

Nice hotel in a good location. Close to high end shopping and some great cocktail bars. Easy access to the subway to reach all the main tourist sites. We had a great room with a view of the imperial palace. The Bathroom was beautiful with a lovely bath - and mood lighting you can choose from, rooms are very luxurious.We had breakfast included - and I wasn’t that impressed. Firstly the restaurant is right near the front entrance of the hotel, which people frequently walk through. It is also al la carte - with a somewhat limited choice. The service was not great either - with us having to request toast repeatedly and reminding the staff to bring the pastry selection.I wouldn’t pay extra to have breakfast included - there are plenty of other options nearby.

We had an excellent time in Tokyo during the Christmas Season. Hotel is amazing, excellent service from arrival. Very accommodating, restaurants are very good. Close to Ginza for shopping and restaurants.

Great location just across imperial palace and directly connected to the subway, and about a minute walk to jr station so getting to places is quite easy. Big rooms with comfortable beds and soft pillows. Good view through their floor to ceiling windows. Nice bathroom complete with amenities. With turndown service at night. Staff were all friendly and helpful. Two restaurant choices for breakfast.

Superb facility, large and very comfortable rooms, friendly and helpful staff (especially the concierges), excellent breakfast menu, and extremely convenient location. This hotel is well worth its price.

The hotel is extremely well located in Maranouchi, opposite the Imperial Gardens and near Ginza. There is actually a metro stop (Hibiya) accessible directly from the hotel, making it particularly convenient in foul weather. Our room was spacious, well designed and had wonderful views of the Imperial Gardens and Hibiya Park. The bed was very comfortable, the bathroom intelligently laid out, and the dressing room area was large enough to have us unpack three suitcases and keep lots of shopping. Lighting throughout is set up with various moods allowing for the right atmosphere. The service was impeccable at the hotel from the courteous and efficient early check-in (courtesy of Amex), to the attentive maid service and breakfast service every morning. Laundry was excellent and quick, and everything came back beautifully wrapped. The pool is large and great for swimming laps, and there is a hot tub as well as an area where you can lounge in with breathtaking city and park views. The spa services are excellent with a great steam room.We only ate in the lobby restaurant but the food was excellent for breakfast and for a late lunch.
user_name:
Dreddlox
New York City, New York

review_body: Having stayed at quite a few Tokyo hotels in various districts, I found the Peninsula to be well located adjacent to Ginza for shopping and dining. Also really handy to access the Imperial Gardens and parklands for a nice walk/siteseeing. The view across from the hotel bar and restaurant area was also superb. I thoroughly enjoyed the excellent hotel service, breakfast dining in the lobby was really good. The rooms were really quite impressive as well feature-wise, a lot of smart additions. I highly recommend the Peninsula and would happily stay there again on my next visit to Tokyo.

The Pensinsula Tokyo is an excellent hotel with great location - opposite Imperial Palace/Gardens, close to Ginza and Hibiya metro stations. Our room was big, very quiet and comfortable. Service was excellent on every level. We used RR limo transfer from Narita which was very convenient and very comfortable; on our way back we used limosuine bus service which had ideal schedule for us - it was cheap, comfortable and on time. Breakfast was very good - they offer European and Japanese style - a la carte.Highly recommended.

No need to write thousand of words. Simply perfect. Service, room, spa, restaurantsVery convenient as close to Ginza (shopping) and emperor park (walk or run), direct access to underground. best hotel for me in Tokyo.

Guaranteed No. 1 Pastries, Absolutely Fabulous taste and appliance in Japan The hotel must be very proud of it ✨✨ Top quality, best of the best Well done 余りにも素晴らしいスイーツに驚きを隠せません。日本では、ココしかないでしょう！繊細で、1つ1つが詳しく味が付いており、口の舌で遊ばせてくれる。こんなにエンターテイメントに優れたペイストリーは初めてと言っても過言ではありません。流石プライドを持って取り組んでらっしゃる。その意思に乾杯です

We stayed twice in this hotel for one night each time. Both times the reception staff was very welcoming, efficient and professional. Rooms are great with everything a traveller could need. I requested an ironing board which was delivered within minutes by a charming lady explaining all I had to know about its operation. Rooms are beautifully appointed. Breakfast service in room was perfect and courteous. Smiling door women greating every guest with a smile. Absolutely perfect. The only thing which was distasteful was upon checking out. As I came down second, check-in had already been done and I simply handed back the key card and walked towards the door. An employee came out rushing after me to check we had properly checked out. It did lack the delicate touch one can expect in such a hotel. But otherwise our stay in the Peninsula was great.

Super luxurious hotel very close to main shopping, dinning and tourists attractions. The rooms are impeccable, extremely clean... all the details have been thought of. Staff, as almost everywhere in Japan, is extremely servicial and attentive. The minor is the price.

The Peninsula Tokyo is a top luxury hotel which ensures an enjoyable stay. I'm thrilled to be able to come back to this fabulous property again for a weekend escapade.The spacious premier room with exciting city views was well equipped with amenities and it was well kept too.The staff were very polite and helpful in attending to my requests. The service rendered by the restaurants staff was warm and attentive too which have made my dining experience more pleasant.I look forward in going back soon.

I always love the understated beauty of the lobby; it was great to be back. The staff is gracious and the rooms are comfortable. Great location at the foot of the Ginza, looking out over the Palace grounds. Dining tip—Japanese fruits are the best in the world, and the musk melon for breakfast is out of this world, I had it five mornings in a row.

I stayed at Peninsula Tokyo for two nights on a business trip and it’s my first time staying there.The location is great - in Ginza but yet not in the middle of shopping belt which gives some exclusivity. Service is excellent! The housekeeper was so meticulous and brought me a spectacles cleaning cloth after seeing that I have a pair of spectacles. The hotel staff were friendly and professional. Will definitely want to stay there again!

We love this hotel so much that we had to adjust our flights this time to be able to stay in this hotel for the entire trip. We were greeted to manager once we arrived and completed check-in in the room - exactly what you want after 16 hours of traveling! The service is excellent, all the staff we contacted including room service speaks perfect English. We booked all restaurants through hotels concierge, they were also great help booking train tickets for us.Swimming pool area is fantastic, we love watching sunset from the smaller hot jacuzzi pool. The pool itself is quite big and almost never too busy.I can also highly recommend Peninsula spa and bastien pedicure in particular, your feet will be reborn after this treatment! Otherwise sauna and relaxation areas in the spa are also excellent.There are tons of nice small restaurants around the hotel and you can always visit Tokyo Plaza Ginza just 5 min walk for fantastic Japanese souvenirs (level 3-4). Also I highly recommend to check Ginza Mitsukoshi department store's (7 min walk from the hotel) underground (B2) food hall, it is truly mind-blowing.One of the best hotel experiences ever and we are always looking forward to come back to The Peninsula Tokyo!

Excellent option to stay in Ginza close to the Imperial Gardens and to the main shopping streets in the area. Top hotel, good bedrooms. Breakfast is not at the level expected for a hotel of this standard. Fitness centre is also a bit small.

My husband & I recently enjoyed a week at the Peninsula Tokyo.From our arrival greeting by the wonderful, kind, patient Jonathan Gould + his team to our send off upon our (reluctant) departure, our stay was a marvel of brilliant service, luxurious accommodations, extraordinary professionalism & courtesy. We were treated kindly, assisted promptly, helpfully & like royalty at every turn. Each & every staff member we encountered was unfailingly helpful, courteous, professional & friendly. What a treat!One of our favorite people, Takao, in the lobby restaurant, where we enjoyed breakfast each morning, made each morning meal a delight. Mark Kusama, the Lobby manager, was another helpful, friendly face. Kudos to General Manager Sonja Vodusek for assembling an amazing team & to Hotel Manager Joseph Lee for his kindness & affability. Everyone, from Mr. Lee, to the front desk personnel, the servers in the restaurant, the transportation department, housekeeping department, bell service, concierges, fitness center staff are a well oiled, smooth machine. Our room, the amenities provided, the extras (the chocolate Rolls Royce, the delicious fruit, the Halloween treats) were beautiful, thoughtful & delightfully presented. The Peninsula Tokyo was the ideal place to end our sojourn in Japan; a soft landing after 3 weeks of rigorous travel. It left us wanting more. We cannot wait to return!

Just finished a stay at the hotel after a business trip a few days before and have to say it was such a great experience. Most of the credit goes to outstanding individual at concierge, Cecilia, who was flawless in everything she did for me. From just her welcoming manner, conversing in so many different languages at one time, and arranging tickets, tours, restaurants bookings and more. The entire staff at the hotel are amazing at every turn. The only disappointment was the gym which is so tiny and crowded but I guess there is not much they can do about that. The treadmills are very close to the ceiling in a couple of places and should be pulled back for taller runners. However that is the only negative. Will definitely be back soon.

We went there for a summer vacation. The rooms were spacious and had a big dressing room. My 3 daughters stayed In One room and could fit all their stuff comfortably. Cleanliness and service was impeccable. Very friendly staff. Perfect for a family vacation. Beautiful area and location.

The Peninsula Tokyo excels at every aspect, from the location (near Ginza, the Imperial Palace, Tokyo Station), room distribution, restaurants, etc. However, the top quality of their service with an extraordinary staff is without a doubt the biggest asset of this hotel. Every single person in the hotel always has a big smile and willing to make you feel at home. It was great to get back to the hotel from a morning run along the Imperial Palace gardens, and being welcomed with a bottle of water and a towel by the hotel staff at the entrance of the hotel. Without a doubt, an extraordinary choice to stay when visiting Tokyo. My wife and I are already planning on going back!

i never really understood using travel agents, but whenever we are now able to utilize ours, we do. We were upgraded to an executive suite thanks to our travel agent. I don't think we've ever stayed in a hotel room so large before. There was a master bath, powder room, living room, changing room, bedroom, dining area, and a desk as well. Unfortunately, we only had The Peninsula booked for one night as it was our trip back home. Located right next to the Imperial Palace.

This is a beautiful new contemporary hotel, maintained with Japanese high standards for service, order and cleanliness. Location good near both the Imperial Palace, modern shopping and quirky restaurants. Our suite was not only lovely and comfortable, it had a lot of thought as to minor issues. Concealed in the bedtable were the buttons for all lights and curtains. Also two plugs for phone, computer, iPad etc. Also had smart night lights that were dim but adequate to find the way in this large room and bathroom. The usual great automatic/Toto toilet with heated seat etc. A great luxury. All room related services were excellent and unobtrusive.Breakfast was served in the lobby (nice) from a good western and Japanese menu. Service excellent, food very good. Sometimes a buffet is also offered in the lower level. Pleasant atmosphere but not the grandeur of the lobby restaurant. We like buffets. This one was very nice but not large. Eggs and other hot dishes available/included from the menu. I am not a lover of contemporary art. However, the art throughout the hotel is frequently part of the architecture and its design. It really worked for me. The staff were exceedingly polite with lots of mutual bowing and thank yous.Highly recommend this hotel.

The last hotel we stayed in on our trip to Japan was the Peninsula Tokyo. It has a perfect location, top notch service, very large comfortable room, and everything you need for a business trip right in the room if you happen to need it. We judged the quality of the various hotels by the bathroom and the Peninsula's was by far the best, the toilet did everything you could imagine the second you opened the door. Lexus has it's most upscale dealership in the world across the street on the ground floor of the mall, you have to see it. One of Tokyo's best bakeries is also on the ground floor of the same mall.

I stayed at the Peninsula for 3 nights earlier this month. Tokyo was the start of my 4 city tour over Asia. Is tased at the best hotels in all cities and The Peninsula was hands down my favorite! The reception and lobby is so relaxing and peaceful. The perfect place to relax and have a drink. We spent many hours in the lobby restaurant.The staff were Amazing! All fo them. The room was my favorite ever!!! The dress room had everything I could need. The bathroom was lovely. The bedroom was spacious with excellent views. It is the perfect room to spend a long time in because everything is not on top of each other. The room is so easy - everything is operated by buttons. The overall experience was a relaxing one! Location of the hotel is also excellent.

First I have to thank Front office Manager Fernando Bass for everything he did for us during our stay, he was very friendly, very attentive to our needs, he helped us with everything, every single morning while we were having breakfast he brought to us the concierge so he could tell us about Tokyo secret spots, he gave us amazing tips about the city and its surroundings, he even sent us a birthday cake to our room since it was my son’s birthday. He gave us a special discount at the Chinese restaurant. Fernando thank you so much for your service, you are an invaluable piece for the peninsula chain. The rooms are quite spacious and well organized, they could use a small refurbishing as they look a little outdated but if you get the view of the imperial palace (this time unfortunately I did not) you will forget everything. Even being a little outdated they are very comfortable, they have a small lounge and a very very big dressing room, the shower, WC and bath are perfect. The breakfast and the food at the Chinese restaurant are exceptional, try the carrot juice for breakfast and any kind of omelette, they are freshly made and perfect in presentation. The Chinese restaurant is amazing, every single thing is delicious and perfectly made) The gym is nice also, the only thing I did not like is you have to fill a registration (like a disclaimer) every time you go to the gym and it takes you a couple of minutes but if you go there every day it can be a little annoying.Overall I truly recommend this hotel, being here for the fourth time of course I would definitely come back again as They made me feel like it’s my home in Tokyo.

From the pickup at the airport until check-out, everything was beyond perfect. The room was incredible and every detail is perfectly cared for. I want to thank the entire team for making our honeymoon memorable.The room is incredibly spacious, and the walk in closet can only be described with: WOW! We were always greeted by name at the door and by every member of the staff we encountered. The food at the lobby restaurant was always great and service was impecable. The Peninsula is worth every dollar. One of the best hotel experiences of my life.Thank you very much!

Stayed here for 4 nights as a treat with a friend. Service is faultless and is how it should be - staff anticipating needs, quietly coming and going without being seen and most importantly, without unnecessary conversation and chitchat but obviously doing their job 110%. Check in and checkout was a breeze and all requests were fulfilled instantly. Gym is also very nice and super clean with latest machines

It is the place to stay in Tokyo but pricey for the service you get. The breakfast is painfully slow and the choice a bit restricted. I guess butter and cheese are rare commodities in Japan as you have to fight for it both at the buffet and in the full service restaurant. The rooms are high tech and the view is nice.

Now I understand why some hotel groups they don’t do loyalty programmes, they simply don’t need it. Clients will just use them again and again despite the fact that they won’t get any points, membership card, diamond privileges.........you name it and they don’t have it! All they harbour under their name is ONE thing, ONE ONE ONE............Customer Experience. Location is superb just a walking distance from the famous shopping street Chuo Dori. This is a perfect location for those food lovers and shopaholics. Lots of nice restaurants on the side streets branching out from the Chuo Dori. It’s situated right next to the Imperial palace and overlooking the Palace and the associated Kokyo Gaien National Garden. You can feel the hospitality of their doorman right from the moment we stepping off from our MK taxi. We were welcomed by their staff and we were led to our room for checking in. The process was swift and the intro of the hotel was quick and clear. The room decor is very traditional, nothing dandy but just.........very practical. You could tell the designer is really a hotel user when you look at the layout and the placement of those illuminated functional buttons. Everything is exactly where they should be. One thing which I have never seen in other hotels is the valet box which allows the hotel staff to deliver stuff to you without disturbing you. The lobby lounge is very Peninsula classy feel. The Chinese food quality is really good even compared to the standard in Hong Kong. The prawn they used for their Chinese prawn dumplings is surely not the frozen ones. The most impressive touch is they retain some of the staff which surely has passed their retirement age. But the mature gentleman that we met at the concierge speaks fluent English and he really knows his stuff well. We really appreciate his knowledge on the palace while we were just asking for directions so that our papa can have a good walk in the park. All in all it’s value for money staying at the Peninsula and I am glad that they are still putting customer service as their top priority despite they are surviving in such a competitive market nowadays. Good work!

The location of this hotel is extraordinary, much better located than the Aman or the Four Seasons. The service is very good, I want to congratulate Mr Fernando Bass, he clearly made all the difference by giving my family and me the best attention, making everything better for us.Thank you !!!

Not much to say other than the rooms and the service in this hotel has got to be in the Top 10 of all hotels on this planet. Of course if one is graced with a room on the Imperial Palace even better. Ever since it opened, the quality has been perfect!

This hotel was perfect.The room spacious, the staff super friendly and the breakfast food very tasty.There’s a gym and a pool.It has a direct entrance to the hibiya station and a 5 min walk to Ginza.I recommend this hotel to anyone.Will definitely come back!

Stayed here for business and leisure for few nights. Nothing to complain! It was a really comfortable stay, staff were always friendly, whenever you come back to hotel you will be greeted. Rooms are very spacious and comfortable, you wouldn't want to leave your room! Breakfast is also good. Location is in business district, but also accessible by train and close to other areas. close to the palace, nice view and good to go for morning runs.my only comment is that the gym is a bit small. but the pool was extremely nice as it had big windows facing the palace.Really enjoyable, possibly best hotel in Tokyo!

We last visited five months ago (in May) and once again have to thank the first-rate team for the wonderful hospitality extended to my family and I. Fernando, the front office manager, was a consistently comforting presence from the time we checked in through the passage of the typhoon that passed Tokyo, and so were the rest of his colleagues from the transportation desk (who very kindly arranged for a transfer to our sushi restaurant) to Carlos at the concierge (who very patiently helped us pick the perfect sushi restaurant and arrange last minute babysitting services) and Hayato-san from in-room dining (who went above and beyond when explaining and setting up our room service dinner and offering gourmet advice). Every trip to the Pen Tokyo is a bitter sweet experience because we know we will need to go back to the real world at some point ... but that just allows us to look forward to our next visit (which is guaranteed since, in the words of the Eagles in their classic Hotel California, we can check out but we can never leave ...). One of the best hospitality experiences you can ever have anywhere in the world - and we will be back again, and again, and again ...

We stayed for four nights at the Peninsula with our four month old daughter on the way to the UK from Australia.The room was amazing - huge in size with a big walk in robe that we ended up using as a bedroom for our daughter (in a cot provided), and very nice bathroom. Floor to ceiling windows gave a view of the city, and there was a seperate lounge area for relaxing in the room. The bed was very comfortable, and we could control everything, including the blinds, without getting up.The service was impeccable, and room service and housekeeping was quick and to a high quality. The hotel lent us umbrellas when raining (watch out - Tokyo is known for umbrella theft so don't leave them anywhere!), and got us cabs when needed.The only downsides were:1. The entertainment options in the room. The TV was large with high quality image, but even though it had a variety of western channels, all but one were dubbed into Japanese! They also have videos on demand, but they were all low grade, z-list movies so you don't want to be stuck in the room.2. The lovely big windows were very dirty on the outside which ruined the view somewhat. More regular cleaning would help.Overall a great stay though and we would definitely stay again.

Possibly the most comfortable hotel and the most impeccable service you will find in your life! Huge rooms, perfect gym and spa. Super helpful concierge. The hotel has a classic, discrete and quiet environment. Highly recommended!

We consider ourselves as experienced travelers all across the globe and I must admit this truly was the best hotel experience of our life time BY FAR!!!. From the moment we arrived to the very last minute of our departure we enjoyed every minute of our stay at this hotel. The staff are simply amazing and they will go all the way to please you even more than your imagination. (They do all of the above without any expectation for any gratuity) Our room was rather large (for Japan standards) with a very large totally separate walk-inn closet, equipped with ladies make up station to also include my wife's favorite, a nail polish dryer system built in the cabinet:-) The bathrooms and showers are works of art and must be seen to be appreciate it. The rooms are equipped with all well functioning electronic gadgets you can think of.This hotel is a 10 min walk from Tokyo Station (Train Station) and from there you can go directly to Narita Airport or literally to any other City in Japan. There are many food establishments right across the street from the hotel. Taxis are all parked on the side street and waiting for you should you need them. This is a must Tokyo experience!!

Stayed in this hotel for about 5 nights. The rooms are beautiful and clean. Staff were great and the location was convenient. I was also surprised that the prices were not as expensive as other Peninsulas. (Maybe I was lucky)

Had a great stay there. Got there early after a drive in from another part of Japan but the service staff were very friendly and helpful as I rested my feet from the long drive in.The room was spacious and very thoughtfully laid out. Loved the little snacks and welcome dessert they provided too... not the most exquisite but nicer than most other hotels i'd say.The hotel concierge was extremely helpful throughout with bookings of restaurants and ohhh they also provide free usage of these wonderful Pencycles! Used it to pedal around the city area and it was GREAT FUN and a somewhat different and interesting (and carbon emissions free) way to get around the areas nearby. Love it!Comfortable beds, great gym and the breakfast was lovely. Great stay... will definitely be back! (P.S. in room coffee could be a tad better.... and the bar located at a relatively high floor at the adjoining Peninsula Mall isn't much to shout about and the cigar smoke from the smoking area, which isn't partitioned, wafted over to the non-smoking area)

Okay this should be the Peninsula, so I hold them to a high standard. Check-in was great and I was impressed with my room, on a high floor with great views of the Imperial Palace. The closet is the size of a small bedroom; the sofa and room setup is comfortable for work and relaxation; the soak tub is good-sized, and the welcome gift of fruit and personal note was highly appreciated. I also thought the controls for the room were well-designed and good for sleeping. It was comfortable as I had expected. But the service was really spotty, unfortunately. After a great check-in experience, I was severely let down by the rooftop restaurant Peter, which was so horribly late on delivery of my dinner order (I think they served it to a large party nearby), that they offered soup and even a free glass of wine to compensate for their error. At these prices, that mistake is unconscionable. The restaurant in the lobby isn't much of an option, given it's bifurcated by the entryway and is totally noisy. The gym is small and was totally crowded at 6am. And the elevators are really slow. The shower was small and dated, though the Oscar de la Renta bath amenities were pretty good. But the towels were pretty aged and stiff, given the quality I had expected.All in all, I was a little let down by the Peninsula, whose service was inconsistent in the quality level I'd expect. I am not sure if I would come back, or just use the nearby Imperial Hotel instead.

We ended our 3 weeks holidays in Japan with a 2 night stay in the Peninsula family suite. When come to hotel stay, I am really fussy and I must said I’m a little OCD in term of cleanliness. Usually in a older hotel if the maintenance is not done right, the place will look pretty awful and tire to me but the Peninsula is just perfect. It is the most comfortable family suite that one can ask for.As for the hotel dinning, the high tea, Sunday brunch is a must try. Food are amazing and view are great and impeccable service.Thanks to Carlos from the concierge, we are able to taste of the best local sushi restaurant in Tokyo, you really can’t get any better than that. Carlos and his team are just amazingly wonderful.Also did I mentioned Sanda from the reservation team. She the best, she has arrived everything such wonderfully that all the 3 kiddo are spoiled.We just have such wonderful time in the peninsula and we will be back again.Thank you so much for taking such good care of us.Tammy

My wife and I stayed in August for the first time. This is not a big hotel but I would pitch it at 6 star. The attention to detail and quality of service from all staff set it apart from most 5 star hotels. It is conveniently situated for Ginza and the Imperial Palace Gardens. Airport bus goes direct to an from the hotel. The underground system is a few minutes walk. Many restaurants in the locale.

The Peninsula Tokyo did not disappoint. Check-in was quick and once completed, my husband and I were escorted to our room where the operation of the many tech gadgets were explained. The one-bedroom suite was well appointed and comfortable and offered amazing views of the hustle and bustle below. The Lobby restaurant was our venue of choice for breakfast and it did not disappoint - the food and service were excellent. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would return to The Peninsula Tokyo if our travels bring us back to this beautiful city.

The Peninsula Tokyo is a quite convenience, walking distance to shopping areas and train stations.You would expect the best service as usual, friendly, thoughtful and professional.I had a junior suite and the size is reasonable. However, what worth to mention is the amenities inside the room. Slippers, bath robes, teeth brush are excellent quality, very comfortable. Heating system under the marble inside the bathroom so that your feet would not get cold. Very thoughtful. Mirror also had similar system behind the scene so that you could still see yourself clearly even though you just had a hot bath. Of course, the bed and pillows were excellent. Regardless how tired I was during the day, I would fully recharged by this very firm high quality mattress.Entire experience from front desk, room and restaurant were excellent. If you are a high demand person just wanted to enjoy every set up and arrangement, you would not be disappointed at the Peninsula Tokyo.

Elegant room, elegant service, true hospitality and luxury! We were there for a few days last Spring and loved it! Irreproachable service and very clean, being Sakura season the lobby and restaurant were filled with huge branches of cherry tree blossoms that made entering the hotel a fantasy world.

As usual peninsula is a guarantee . Very well located in Ginza close to imperial palace and incredible shopping area. Beautiful rooms with views, very good service, nice spa... you fell really relaxed and and a happy customer! We had a great staying.

We stayed here during one night at the end of July and I think, having stayed in a few hotels in Tokyo (including New Otani and Mandarin), I have to say, this one is by far my favorite. Firstly, the hotel is gorgeous, after entering the hotel the first feeling I got was that everything was bright and beautiful. Upon checking in we were told that we had a complimentary upgrade and were placed in a gorgeous room facing the imperial palace with a full view of it. The room was extremely spacious, clean, and comfortable, the bathroom was gorgeous, the bath and the shower were a real treat. The wifi was free and I could have stayed in that room forever. Unlike the Mandarin, the Peninsula does not require to change lifts to access your room. The location was fantastic. As mentioned, it is near the Imperial Palace (which is well worth going to) and near Ginza station and all the stores (easy 15 minute walk max) as well as Marunouchi. For other travellers who may be interested, there's also a 7-11 or lawson nearby if you feel like getting anything there (I got an ice cream).The service was spectacular, from check-in to check-out, the staff were helpful, attentive, informative, and happy to answer any questions. They always had a smile and were extremely pleasant - I've rarely found the same service anywhere else. On top of that, because I was travelling with a friend and we were both girls they changed the toiletries in the room (which usually has one set for male and one female) accordingly. Whilst the Mandarin has more restaurants in the hotel, the food at the Peninsula is wonderful. They have an elaborate Japanese breakfast which is delicious, their room service is fantastic, everything from pasta to rice dishes are available so you'll not be short of options and the food is gorgeous so you won't be disappointed. Really really loved this hotel and wish we'd stayed here for longer. Thank you Peninsula!

The Peninsula is a ridiculously lovely hotel. It gets the small things right so the big things fall into place. The rooms are large with big bathrooms and a walk in dressing room that is bigger than some hotel rooms. The service is excellent, we asked for an iron, extra coffee etc and it was all made available swiftly and with no fuss. We used the Spa which has a 20m pool, hot tub, sauna, steam room and gym. Again the staff were attentive providing robes, goggles and slippers. The bar on the 24th floor has views of Tokyo and the bar staff where happy to conjure up whatever cocktails we wanted. The concierge, as you would expect, were very knowledgeable and helpful. The hotel's location means that it's a short stroll to midtown and Ginza, while the Imperial Palace gardens are a block or so away. I can't recommend the Peninsula more.

Top notch elegant place. We had adjoining rooms for the kids and it was large and luxurious. Service is amazing. Really a spectacular hotel in a fantastic location. I would rate the property higher than the palace thought the palace location is a little better - walking distance to palace. Great place though. Highly recommend.

This is an elegant hotel smack dab in Marunouchi in Tokyo, on one side the Ginza upscale shopping area in the other direction HIbiya Park and the Imperial Palace. The service is exquisite. The owners, the Kadoori family boast as the largest fleet of Rolls Royces outside of the UK, which they traditionally used to pick up passengers in Hong Kong airport staying at their landmark hotel in Kowloon, near the Star Ferry. You may find a vintage Rolls Royce displayed right outside of the hotel. This hotel is service at its finest.

Very well located, amazing service, beautiful rooms, specular view, and a very nice pool.Extremely helpful concierge, I strongly recommend Ms. Cecilia Clauzier that was incredibly helpful in making our first trip to Japan pleasant.We will be back.

Everything is just perfect! And I mean everything! Not sure if I can really give constructive comments to this hotel. Well, maybe, it would be better it the fitness center provides gym outfits to the users and if there are channels on the tv :P This is definitely one of my top 3 favourite hotels in the world for sure.

I have stayed in quite a few 5 star hotels in tokyo and maybe my past experiences really spoiled me.This will be our first stay in the Peninsular tokyo. As before, I contacted the concierge desk for restaurants reservations several months in advance. Given the fierce competition to reserve tokyo's hot restaurants, I have grown to expect prompt (same day) response and actions. This is NOT the case so far with the Peninsula. After the initial acknowledgement, I have not heard from the concierge desk for the past couple days ... this makes me really concerned what will happen when the restaurants start to take reservatiosn. Seats will be gone within a couple hours. I have never experienced anything similar with concierge response at other 5-star hotels in tokyo. I hope I am not overracting. Plus, my initial email asking the front desk via email to confirm my reservation was totally ignored. they just noticed my request to contact concierge desk and forwarded it. Not a single word on the confirmation.
user_name:
kurumis2014
New York City, New York

review_body: I had stayed here about 10years ago, and remember nothing but good impressions. Now a lot of the good points remain - sizeable, well-designed rooms, great pool and spa, good food. This time though I noticed a few negatives. The rooms towards the back of the hotel are quite noisy - you are effectively sleeping next to busy railway tracks and train noise is constant from about 5am to after midnight. Sound insulation is not good. The lobby remains a negative for me, though many people love it. Essentially on arrival you have to make your way through a very crowded coffee shop to the check-in desks right at the back. Moreover, there is a ‘minstrels’ gallery’ above the coffee shop where a live band plays ‘smooth jazz’ Kenny G style all day and evening. I’m not a fan of background muzak anywhere but here it seems inappropriate and overly loud. Last the power charging options: hidden in a drawer by the bed, which somewhat disrupts the meticulous attention to detail in the rest of the room’s design - see photo. Staff are efficient but oddly robotic and not especially friendly, which is odd for Japan

We wrapped up a three week vacation in japan at The Peninsula, Tokyo which coincided with my husbands birthday. The rooms are very well appointed, spacious, and with thoughtful amenities. The swimming pool, housekeeping staff really are great. The other staff - both at the reception and the breakfast area at the lobby are quite high handed and pretentious which in general gives the property an overall uncomfortable vibe. If you can get past that, the location of the hotel is also a plus - close to the lively Ginza area and the Imperial Palace. Overall, I wouldn’t stay here or at another hotel of the chain. For what you pay, the hotel may be luxurious but the service, and what makes the hotel special is definitely not luxury.

This is a very good hotel and I like it a lot. It has a delicious bakery below it and underground access as well. The beds are comfortable and the room comes well made. It is across from the park so you can go out there and have a long work. It is very centred and provides fast, free WiFi for you to use. I would recommend getting breakfast included at is wildly overpriced to eat in. The staff are also friendly and kind. It is one of the high end hotels Tokyo has to offer with rooms that have good views of the city. However it is very expensive however which lets it down. Hope you found this helpful,Ethan

Great hotel if you can out for dinner in the evening. Only ashprtwalk from activity in the evening so location is greatStaff are very friendly and everything runs smoothlyPool and gym are very good too

My family of four stayed here during the first leg of a two week trip to Japan and it was a perfect jumping off point for the trip. The location is great and the lobby is very inviting with beautiful woodwork and art. Many times, there were musicians performing there as we came through, which was a nice touch. As others have mentioned, there's a cafe/restaurant in the lobby which you walk through to get to the reception desk, but we didn't mind and if gives it a little more of a lively feel. This lobby area is also where they serve breakfast, which absolutely shouldn't be missed as it was a highlight. Since we are from the U.S., we had the western breakfast most mornings, but on the final day we tried the dim sum breakfast, which was fantastic.We had two premier rooms, one king and one double (for the kids). As one would expect, they were identical except for the bed configuration. They are quite large and, as others have mentioned, include a large dressing room which is one of those things that you don't realize that you need until you have it! Now I wish all my hotel rooms had a large area like this to sit and do hair/makeup as well as organize all our belongings.The first evening, we had dinner at Kyoto Tsuruya which was very nice but we were tired from our long trip and honestly I don't remember anything too memorable about it (probably just because I was too tire to enjoy it properly). In hindsight, we should have gone to Peter, which looked fabulous but we never got a chance because we had made reservations on all the other nights elsewhere. Speaking of reservations, the Peninsula's concierge service was extremely helpful while planning this trip and they secured a great table at Kyubey Sushi for us and, to our surprise, even offered the hotel car, a beautiful Rolls Royce, to shuttle us there. What a special night!Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel and honestly, we wish we had spent more time there. The employees are so attentive and everyone goes out of their way to make sure your needs are met. Absolutely a five star experience in Tokyo.

We started our family vacation in Japan at the peninsula...it was great. Our room was not ready as we got to the hotel early in the morning but they arranged for us to use their pool and we were upgraded. The room was so spacious with an amazing view of the imperial palace. Breakfast was good, staff were always really helpful. The hotel is well located and there in direct access to the underground station. I would definitely stay here again if I return to Tokyo.

I had a very good overall experience in staying at Penisula Tokyo. Nice restaurants, good ambience but they prioritize their clients too obviously. Bills will be put in front of you while you are having breakfast to make room for other clients; the pride of the staff serving at the lobby restaurant for breakfast makes you feel very uncomfortable especially if you dress causal. But as a hotelier, the golden rule is that you never know who you are serving and you never know what will you miss out of these.

Very good hotel. Smooth check in, lovely spacious room with great shower and efficient WiFi. Lovely bed too. Only drawback was speed of service at breakfast. As it is a la carte and not buffet it’s outside of your control how long it took... and on my second morning it was unacceptably slow. The food was however very good. Staff friendly throughout. Recommended but I will allow more time for the breakfast next time.

Stayed unfortunately only one night but what a lovely night. Swimming pool was a hit with the family. The breakfast was amazing - the staff were very helpful and helped with how to say things. Lovely canadian/japanese chap and one of the most beautifully spoken english from a very kind young man. We slept really well in very comfortable beds after a long flight. All in all a lovely experience. Mary

Firest the location is great ,the view from the top is spectacular .Breakfast at lobby was very good specially the Japanese breakfast ( minimal cholesterol/ fats) The rooms are spacious confortable but the bathroon is spectacular Everything is electronic including the toilet!!!Highly recommended...

The hotel is fantastic. We have stayed in the Peninsula in Hong Kong since the 1960s and so had reservations about whether the Tokyo one could live up to the high standards of the Hong Kong one. It certainly does. The rooms are wonderful, the staff are so incredibly helpful and the spa/pool area really relaxing and tranquil.

Great location but breakfast and dinner in lobby area with check in is too busy. People getting on busses while your sitting there trying to have a simple meal or a quick morning meeting. Again The staff was superb. The rooms were great just need to figure out a better place for morning breakfast. FYI a Starbucks is around the corner

Everything that you come to see in Tokyo can almost be seen from this hotel! From Hibiya Park to the Imperial Garden. On top of the spacious room, great service and kind people, the view is what sold me. What I saw outside my floor-to-ceiling window is exactly what I pictured Tokyo to be.

We choose the Peninsula because we were looking for a special place to celebrate our anniversary and were not disappointed. We arrived by car a little after 11 am and were warmly greeted and escorted to checking. The lobby is anything but traditional. You literally walk through the lobby restaurant on your way to check-in. It is a little odd but at first, provides a great opportunity for people watching as we enjoyed our breakfast the next morning. As we were passed off to the front desk associate the warm pleasantries continued. This being our first trip to Japan I was surprised at how respectful yet friendly the people in Japan were. Check-in was completed within 5 minutes and we were escorted to our room. I should note for all those first timers out there that tipping in Japan is not done. So do not worry about the consistent interaction as it’s not a ploy for a tip but rather just a level of service that is maintained because that’s what service should be.Our room was large featuring a hallway with a closet/dressing room on one side and a large bath on the other. The Hallway opened to a large bedroom that was well appointed with a dining area, sitting area, workspace and King bed. The room featured a significant amount of automation in addition to several over the top items like a fax/copier and a cappuccino machine. The room was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. Wi-Fi was complimentary and fast enough to support streaming video content.The hotel itself is located in close proximity to the Imperial Palace, so close that we were able to walk to the place for a tour. Additionally, the property is surrounded by restaurants and other hotels so you don’t need to walk far to find a bite to eat or a drink. The Peninsula offered multiple restaurants on site so you really didn’t need to look far for a great meal. We really enjoyed Hei Fung Terrace, the Cantonese restaurant onsite as well as the pastry shop for breakfast on the lower level. One hidden gem at this property is that it has its own entrance to the subway. Take the elevator to the lower level and a walkway provides an easy path to Hibiya station. Overall, a great location with fantastic service an all-around wonderful property. We look forward to coming back!

To kick off our trip to Japan, we booked 6 nights at the Peninsula Tokyo and so glad we chose it. I know there are many options in Tokyo but if looking for a luxurious hotel with an amazing staff, I would highly recommend this hotel. We booked two rooms with breakfast. It was perfect for us. The morning breakfast was delicious and we were always impressed by the professionalism of the staff and the added touch of a member asking about our stay and plans and usually remembering the next day to ask about our previous day tours. It was added touches like this that really puts the hotel in a special class. We also found the front desk, concierge, bell staff, etc. all to be very helpful and attentive. Of course, the rooms were well appointed and spacious. Having a separate dressing area, lovely bathroom and a beautiful sleeping/seating area were perfect. Gym and pool were great too. Really can't say enough. Location, with metro access in the basement and easy walk to Ginza worked great for us too.

We stayed for 3 nights at the Peninsula Tokyo and our experience there was phenomenal. We stayed in a Deluxe Suite which was over 1200 sqft and overlooked the Imperial Palace Gardens and Hibiya Park. The living and dining rooms were spacious with ceiling-to-floor windows and the bedroom was privately tucked away. The main bathroom was luxurious to say the least, in marble and stone. Two sinks, an oversized bath, lots of space. We loved how there was a separate powder room in the lobby- perfect when you have little kids. No need to fight for the washroom toilet! The open concept closet even had a little private laundry chute for laundry/ dry cleaning service. You put the dirty clothes through the chute and someone collects it on the other side. The next morning, you open the door and voila, your laundry is clean and neatly folded. Service was exceptional- they somehow knew I was pregnant (with my third!) and I was delighted to find a special soap and shampoo kit for expectant mothers in the bathroom. You can ask for the Rolls Royce or Mini Cooper service (complimentary within 1-2 km)! Concierge and front desk were always most helpful. The breakfasts, though not buffet-style, were also lovely and aesthetically presented. All in all, we had an amazing time at the Peninsula. Stay here- you will be WOWed!

Once again what a way to finish off our Japan holiday with a stay at the Peninsula. It just gets better! Everything was perfect, room, service, staff, spa & pool, not to mention breakfast to die for! Get what you pay for!!!!! I’ll be back!

Typical example of you get what you pay for. A friend and myself went there to enjoy the Sunday Brunch. From start to finish we were plied with 2009 Dom Perignon for our 50th birthday celebration, (very happily). They gave us an amazing table overlooking the Emperor’s palace. We were immediately greeted by a very professional and charming manager from Hong Kong, who apparently was over to observe and work at the Tokyo Peninsula. Incidentally, both managers introduced themselves, (one from Hong Kong and one from Japan), both were very jovial and made us feel very welcome. All the staff were very polite, amazingly professional and did the hotel very proud. Have I ever stayed at a Peninsula? “Never”, would I, “Yes”. It’s the people that make the party, and the staff, all of them, came through SO well. We didn’t feel rushed and we loved the whole experience. See you soon truly, and thank you so much for making our brunch so special! Cannot recommend the Sunday brunch enough.

Checked in The Peninsula Tokyo last week. As usual, I did my morning run. After circling the Royal Palace in the sunny day sweating, upon walking into the entrance of the hotel, unexpectedly, there is a towel, a bottle of water and a warm smile waiting for me... As a frequent global traveler, this warm service took me completely by surprise!!This is service from HEART. I really enjoyed my stay here and certainly will come back again. One more to mention is that, Johnny Qin, the trainee from Beijing Peninsula also provided us excellent services and professional attention. All in all, great hotel, great people and great location.

At first I faced the same situation as erooney2014. The tax and fees are hidden and only show after the booking. I highlighted this to the hotel and they highlighted the tiny figure after the booking explaining it’s mentioned. They seem not to get the point. On top of this the concierge couldn’t deliver our exact requests to the resturaunt. They also don’t call in a car when instructed to do so. The AC wasn’t working one night and we informed them. The engineer arrived to fix it and informed us it’s due to the maintenance they had the day before. So weird they wouldn’t bother. My brother had to be hospitalized for a night for losing a lot of electrolytes from sweating all night. They dismissed a turndown service. When informed they apologized but repeated the same dismissal for turndown service the day after. The bed boards are full of dust and debris. They also have the audacity to ask at check out “other than the problems we faced” how has my family enjoyed Tokyo?!?!

We stayed 5 nights hereOur first stayed was Peninsula Hong Kong in Dec 2017. That prompt us to stay here. I guess, Penisula will be our preferred hotel from now onLocation: Excellent--------------------------Food and drinks of all kinds (including Michelin Star Restaurant) are walking minutes away. Shopping, every corner you turn (after all its Ginza Shopping Area). Metro entrance too.Room: Fantastic.----------------------Our suite is very spacious (Japan Standard). Good View. Fully Equiped. Service: Excellent------------------------Peninsula service is always excellent. Friendly, courteous and teamwork. Fluent English speaking staff too. We sincerely would like to extend our "Thank You" to the Peninsula Team for making our recent Tokyo trip our best Japan vacations so far. You kind assistance in getting us booking at Sushi Yoshitake and Koyju made our trip even more memorable. We will be back soon

Nothing to say much except that this hotel is perfect in all aspects; location, service, ambiance and room quality.If you follow Peninsula’s IG, they create the hashtag called ‘penmoments’, which I just have experienced in this time.When I was back into the hotel from jogging around Imperial Palace, the staff (either bellboys or concierge) came hurry to provide me towel and a bottle of water and said ‘for your refreshment’. This is really impressed as Peninsula Tokyo shows that they really care of their guests even of small detail. Therefore, this is my ‘penmoments’.If you come around this season, you should try their ‘Blooming Afternoon Tea’. It’s delicious and well presented.Lastly, I will definitely come back here without hesitation.

You can’t go to stay at a hotel like thos without knowing it’s gonna be a really good one, but what stroke me the most was the incredible attention to detail in everything from the room, to the service they provide and the spa and pool area. Probably superior to all other hotels I’ve stayed at. Concierge was fantastic and helped me get reservations at high-end restaurants, one in particular that is notoriously famous for being hard to get in to. Not just a hotel stay but also a fantastic experience

This hotel, like all Peninsula Hotels, take service to the highest level. The rooms are a good size for Asia and are very well appointed. The gym is much better than many hotel workout rooms. The staff is welcoming, professional and helpful. My only gripe about this hotel is the main lobby. A great hotel like the Peninsula should have a grand lobby for people to gather and meet, or just relax while waiting. The entire hotel lobby at the Peninsula Tokyo is taken up with a restaurant. Other than a couple of benches in the main corridor, that are often full, there is no where to sit and wait for a colleague or have a short meeting. The lack of a grand lobby keeps the hotel being the great place it could be.

This is my second stay with the Peninsula in Tokyo and it's definitely my go to for location, service and comfort. The hotel immediately remembered that I was a returning guest and all the check-in formalities are handled comfortably in the room. The standard room is larger than my 2 bedroom apartment in San Francisco with a beautiful full bathroom and walk-in closet. I love the valet closet feature at this hotel; newspaper and laundry and delivered discreetly. The bathroom has an incredible mood lighting/music setting that feels like you're at the spa. The bed is sumptuous and the blackout curtains do wonders for a weary, jet lagged traveler. The food and beverage is certainly very expensive, as is the spa, but I'm impressed with the attention to detail and considerate service at every corner. I had a beautiful view of the Imperial Gardens and the hotel is very convenient to Tokyo station and businesses in Marounouchi district.

We stayed in a one bedroom suite with lots of space and a view. The hotel sits in a nice location - Tokyo Station is walkable (without a lot of luggage) and the area is pleasant. Staff members are warm and welcoming. Breakfast was included with our booking, so we enjoyed it. However I wouldn't pay for it outright when there are many cheaper options just around the corner from the hotel. My only issue was with the bedding. The linens weren't very soft and the pillows were uncomfortable. I asked for firmer pillows, which were brought right away and that helped. I feel like a few details like the bed linens are due for an upgrade. Overall, it's a solid hotel with an excellent staff.
user_name:
wholewideworld
New York City, New York

review_body: Beautiful hotel. Excellent service. Our room was gorgeous. Bed very comfortable. Separate dressing room and bathroom were enormous. Staff very helpful and friendly. The concierge was so helpful. Only issue for us was the Peter bar and restaurant allows smoking. While having a drink at the bar a gentleman lit up a cigar and we had to leave. All in all we would definitely stay here again.

The Japanese are renowned for their politeness .. the Tokyo Pen is everything and more .. the bed is heavenly ... the Japanese breakfast exquisite .. the concierge is one of the best in getting you in to the best places to eat. From the bell boys to the front office staff to the housekeeping staff , all fantastic .. of course the location is so so convenient ... a short walk to Ginza shopping and all the great restaurant . If you are in Tokyo for a special occasion and is prepared to splash a great experience , Pen Tokyo comes highly recommended . ..

The Peninsula is our home for a week in Tokyo.From the doorman, to the Lobby restaurant staff, to the managers (who all have introduced themselves and had nice friendly chats) and all the friendly team - a big thank you. Smiles and a Arigato or Welcome Back every time we come back to the hotel. Wonderful.The suites are fantastic. More room than you ever need. The bathrooms huge and so well equipped. The dressing room is almost the size of a typical Tokyo hotel room. Service is discreet and first class.The location is fabulous with Hibiya station straight under, Ginza a short stroll and the parks nearby.One of the best hotels in the world. Six star!

I love Peninsula. The room is so well appointed, clean and fresh. Service is efficient and really felt at home. The cost of pampering yourself by staying in this hotel is on the high side but if you have the cash to spend and want to impress stay at the Peninsula. Excellent experience.

This Peninsula is conveniently located in the prime area of Tokyo, next to Ginza, Royal palace and the Tokyo station. The room is elegant and spacious! We love the dressing room that can easily fit lots of clothes and luggages. All other room features are as good as other Peninsula hotels.The gym is well equipped and the heated pool is awesome!!!The lobby restaurant is good for all day dining, service is attentive as usual.We love the French restaurant on top, the steak was great! This place is definitely a top address in Tokyo, my favorite place of all time!

Stayed here again as a return visitor, its simply amazing. From the time you enter , till the time you leave, the hotel staff makes you feel everything catered to your personal needs. The rooms are large and awesome. The location is quite central and closer to CBD and ton of restaurants to eat and also shopping is few steps way. I would certainly stay here. Rooms are certainly pricey, however i think you get what you pay for
user_name:
Nycnls
New York City, New York

review_body: Great service with a smile, fabulous concierge team. Beautiful room, plenty of space with wonderful cotton kimono robes. Lovely amenities. Comfortable beds. Good breakfast. Only complaint is Bar Peter is smoky. Wish there was a lobby bar. Great location
